xserver.name: X server
xserver.description: Virtual X Server and vnc client to connect to. Allows to start GUI apps in the box. Uses 3050 port for desktop access

apache.name: HTTP Apache 2 server
apache.description: A secure, efficient and extensible server that provides HTTP services in sync with the current HTTP standards.

python2.name: Python2 tools set
python2.description: Set of tools for python2 development.

python3.name: Python3 tools set
python3.description: Set of tools for python3 development.

openjdk8.name: Java 8 (OpenJDK)
openjdk8.description: Java is a general purpose, high-level programming language.

openjdk11.name: Java 11 (OpenJDK zulu)
openjdk11.description: Java is a general purpose, high-level programming language.

nodejs.name: NodeJS
nodejs.description: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine. Node.js uses an event-driven, non-blocking I/O model that makes it lightweight and efficient.

deno.name: Deno
deno.description: Deno is a JavaScript, TypeScript, and WebAssembly runtime with secure defaults and a great developer experience.

zsh.name: Zsh shell
zsh.description: Zsh is a shell designed for interactive use, although it is also a powerful scripting language.

gdb.name: GDB
gdb.description: The GNU Project debugger, allows you to see what is going on `inside' another program while it executes -- or what another program was doing at the moment it crashed.

mongo.name: MongoDB
mongo.description: MongoDB (from humongous) is a cross-platform document-oriented database. Classified as a NoSQL database.

mysql.name: MySQL
mysql.description: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system (RDBMS)

python-lsp.name: Language Server for Python
python-lsp.description: A Python 2.7 and 3.4+ implementation of the Language Server Protocol making use of Jedi, pycodestyle, Pyflakes and YAPF.

java-lsp.name: Language Server for Java
java-lsp.description: The Eclipse JDT Language Server is a Java language specific implementation of the Language Server Protocol.

ocaml-lsp.name: Language Server for OCaml
ocaml-lsp.description: A language server for OCaml and related languages.

ungit.name: Ungit
ungit.description: The easiest way to use git.

autostart.name: Autostart Support
autostart.description: Script autostart for ~/startup.sh, workspace startup.sh and .guides/startup.sh as BASH files

omnidb.name: OmniDB
omnidb.description: browser-based tool that simplifies database management, starts on 5000 port

mariadb.name: MariaDB
mariadb.description: MariaDB is an open-source relational database management system (RDBMS)

vscode.name: VSCode
vscode.description: Visual Studio Code is a free source-code editor made by Microsoft. Runs on 4000 port. 1G box or more is recommended.

pencilcode.name: PencilCode
pencilcode.description: Pencilcode server on Codio. Runs on 8008 port.

r-studio.name: R Studio
r-studio.description: R is an open-source programming language and free environment that specializes in statistical computing and graphical representation.
